newsitem.title: GERMANY: TENNIS-TEENAGER WEINGAERTNER KEEPS GERMANS IN TIE.
newsitem.headline: TENNIS-TEENAGER WEINGAERTNER KEEPS GERMANS IN TIE.

text.p: Little-known teenager Marlene Weingaertner pulled off a surprise victory on her debut to keep Germany in contention in their Fed Cup clash with the Czech Republic on Saturday.
The 17-year-old Weingaertner beat Ludmila Richterova 3-6 7-5 6-3 in the opening singles of the world group one tie.

Although the Czechs levelled to 1-1 when Adriana Gersi defeated Barbara Rittner 6-4 6-2 in the second singles, the Germans were expecting to struggle against the powerful Czechs without the injured Steffi Graf and Anke Huber.
The Germans' chances of putting up a fight were helped by the late withdrawal from Saturday's singles of leading Czech player Jana Novotna, who is suffering with shingles.
She is still hoping to play in Sunday's doubles which could turn out to be decisive.
Weingaertner's performance has given the home side an extra boost, nevertheless.
"I don't know what to say," she said. "I was very nervous at the start but the crowd really gave me a lift."
